result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:12 PM Defendant Christopher L Stadler in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. in court for Christopher L Stadler.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Case has now been amended to a felony offense. Atty Piel confirms receipt of the amended criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court sets for will set for Status of Preliminary Hearing on November 15, 2022 at 3:45 PM. Via zoom. 

Court adjourned at 3:14 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Christopher L Stadler appeared by video.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for Christopher L Stadler.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Piel. Court sets for plea and sentencing on October 4, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
Defendant's
Scheduling Order

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Christopher L Stadler in court.  Attorney Walter Arthur Piel Jr. appeared by video for Christopher L Stadler.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Piel advises that the matter is not resolved and request this matter be put on the trial calendar. Court sets for Status Hearing on July 12, 2022 at 1:30 PM and all motions and witness lists are to be filed the day before. Court has no objection to zoom.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (for the atty)
Letter to the Court from Atty Piel dated May 2, 2022 re: request to appear via phone
Review hearing on May 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Status Report
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
State's
Return date on April 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter from Atty Walter A. Piel dated Jan 13, 2022 re: Cover Letter for Notice of Retainer and Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Atty Walter A. Piel

Adjustment Number: 22A 001379,
Payable Number: 67481,
Receipt Number: 22R 000192,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Second appearance on January 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

10:06 AM Defendant Christopher L Stadler appeared by video, Attorney Bradford Paul Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant would like to get an attorney. Court determines def stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the def. ADA Bollmann makes bond recommendation. Statement by the def regarding bond. Court sets bond at $5,000 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription. You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. This needs to be completed by Jan 14, 2022 or a warrant could be issued for the def. Court will set for Status of Counsel Jan 25, 2022 at 10:00 Am. 

Court adjourned at 10:12 AM.

Defendant called Clerk of Courts office and stated that he is home on quarantine and could appear via Zoom telephone. He was given Zoom instructions. Defendant confirmed address and telephone number on file are correct.

Defendant called Clerk of Courts office and requested an adjournment to hire an attorney.  His hearing has been rescheduled to January 4, 2022 at 9:00 a.m. Defendant confirmed address and telephone number on file are correct.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
Copy of Letter from GLSO to defendant dated 10/04/2021 re: Court date and time temporarily adjourned to wait for blood results
